intro: Scleranthus orthocarpus, commonly known as the upright sand-plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in disturbed or coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and sometimes hairy, and the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Scleranthus orthocarpus is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in dry, open habitats.
